intro: Cupania roraimae, commonly known as the Roraima cupania, is a flowering plant native to the tepuis of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in the humid, nutrient-poor soils of high-altitude regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
